title: Kimono

adjectives: Consisting of or derived from tradition
Observant of tradition; attached to old customs; old-fashioned.
Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language
Of, relating to, or derived from Japan, its language, or culture.
verbs: To fit out with the necessary clothing; to clothe, put clothes on (something or someone).
To adorn or cover with clothing; to dress; to supply clothes or clothing.
To put clothes on something or somebody.
To dress; to put on clothes; to clothe oneself.
nouns: A loose robe; imitated from robes originally worn by Japanese

Traditional Japanese clothing.
A traditional Japanese robe-like garment that is now generally worn only in formal occasions.

Adult female human being.
Clothing, garments, dress, material.

Clothing is material used to cover parts of the human body for protection against the environment, for comfort and body modesty, and as personal decoration, often reflecting religious, cultural, and social customs.
Clothing is fiber and textile material worn on the body.
Clothes.
Clothes considered as a group.
All coverings designed to be worn on a person's body.

(in combination) clothing

Popular trends.

Term for a popular style or practice in clothing, make-up, furniture, etc.

Any loose flowing garment

Loose-fitting outer garment

A light kimono.

description: A traditional Japanese robe that can be worn by women or men.
